clinical_study.brief_title: School-Based Mental Health Program Implementation in Uganda
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing a School-based Mental Health Prevention Program in Ugandan Schools

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Implementation of an adapted ParentCorps program in Ugandan schools will improve school mental health service resources, teachers' knowledge about child mental health, and teachers' classroom behavioral management and parent involvement skills.

detailed_description.textblock:
Participating schools are randomly assigned to a 6-month long school-based intervention or to a wait-list control group. The intervention focuses on improving teacher's classroom behavioral management practices, parent engagement, and child mental health knowledge.
Teachers are assessed at the beginning and the end of the study, and again after 6 months of intervention. Teachers' parent engagement, mental health knowledge, and behavioral practices in the classroom are assessed through observations and teacher ratings.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome will be measured 3 times--before interveniton, after intervention (about 6 month after the baseline assessment), and 6-month post intervention (about 6 months after the 2nd evaluation)
primary_outcome.description: Teacher classroom behavioral management skills and parent engagement practices will be measured

clinical_study.condition: Teacher Skills in Addressing Child Mental Health Problem

arm_group.description: Teachers from Intervention schools will receive ParentCorps training and support.
Teachers from control schools will not receive training and support in Year 1, but will receive training and support in Year 2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Early childhood teachers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not early childhood teachers
